title: Mega investment: Nadella meets PM; Microsoft commits record $17.5bn for India's AI future
content: Microsoft is investing $17.5 billion in India, its largest investment in Asia, to bolster the nation's digital infrastructure and AI capabilities. CEO Satya Nadella announced the commitment following a discussion with Prime Minister Narendra Modi, aiming to support India's "AI first future" by developing essential infrastructure, skills, and sovereign capabilities.

title: IndiGo flight crisis: Govt curtails airline's ops by 10%; CEO updates aviation ministry
content: Aviation authorities have slashed IndiGo's winter flight schedule by 10% following widespread passenger disruptions. The airline, which previously faced a 5% cut, will now operate significantly fewer flights due to internal mismanagement of crew rosters and inadequate communication. This move aims to stabilize operations and reduce cancellations, with IndiGo submitting a revised schedule soon.

title: Goa club fire: Portion of beach shack owned by Luthra brothers razed - watch
content: Days after a devastating fire at Birch by Romeo Lane claimed 25 lives, authorities demolished a section of the Romeo Lane restaurant in Goa's Vagator area. The structure, owned by Gaurav and Saurabh Luthra, was found to have encroached on the beach. Officials confirmed a 198-square-meter area was cleared.

title: Sam Altman says industry is wrong on OpenAI's competition, it is not from Google, but ...
content: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman has declared Apple its ultimate rival, shifting focus from AGI to device-centric AI.  A 'code red' memo halts moonshot projects to boost ChatGPT's performance, driven by aggressive talent raids from Apple.  Meanwhile, Google's Gemini surges, forcing OpenAI to prioritize mass-market appeal and user feedback to regain dominance.

title: 'Choose any day Samson over him': Gill fails on return; fans target 'poster boy'
content: Shubman Gill returned from injury but was out for just four runs in the first T20I against South Africa. He was dismissed early in the match. This performance drew criticism on social media. Gill had recovered from a neck injury. South Africa won the toss and chose to bowl.

title: 'Vote chori biggest anti-national act': Rahul in Lok Sabha during SIR debate; slams RSS
content: Rahul Gandhi accused the Election Commission of India of colluding with the BJP to rig elections, calling "vote chori" the biggest anti-national act. He questioned the removal of the CJI from the EC selection panel and alleged the RSS is capturing national institutions, including intelligence agencies and investigative bodies, to suppress opposition.

title: Amazon wants employees to call AI agents 'teammates', not tools
content: Amazon is championing AI agents as autonomous coworkers, not just tools, predicting they'll drive 80-90% of enterprise AI value. This vision emerges as Amazon cuts thousands of corporate jobs, sparking concerns about AI's role in workforce displacement.

title: Goa club fire: Owner Gaurav Luthra spotted at Thailand airport; 1st image out
content: Goa nightclub owners, Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra, have fled to Thailand following a devastating fire that killed 25 people. Authorities issued a Look Out Circular and are coordinating with Interpol for their arrest.  Meanwhile, a third individual, Bharat Kohli, has been apprehended in Delhi and handed over to Goa police.

title: Smriti Mandhana updates Insta bio after wedding with Palash called off
content: Cricketer Smriti Mandhana confirmed her wedding to music composer Palash Muchhal has been called off, urging an end to speculation. Muchhal also stated he has "decided to move on" and warned of legal action against rumour-mongers. Mandhana emphasized her focus remains on representing India in cricket.

title: 'IndiGo back on its feet': CEO says ops stable; airline focusing on what led to crisis
content: IndiGo CEO Pieter Elbers assures operations are stabilizing after a recent crisis, with refunds issued and flights restored to all 138 destinations. The Civil Aviation Minister holds IndiGo accountable, emphasizing passenger convenience. The DGCA has mandated a 5% cut in IndiGo's winter schedule due to operational inefficiencies, with further reductions possible as the airline works to stabilize.

title: Want to use your old smartphone as a home security camera? How to set it up
content: Transform your old smartphone into a home security camera with a simple app. This cost-effective DIY solution allows you to monitor your home, children, or pets remotely. By installing a security app on your old phone and your current device, you can set up a functional surveillance system. While convenient, be aware of limitations compared to professional cameras.

title: Ayesha Curry admits feeling anger when women try to pursue Stephen Curry
content: Ayesha Curry revealed on 'Red Table Talk' that she sometimes feels the urge to confront women who approach her husband, Stephen Curry, due to his naturally friendly demeanor. She later expressed regret about her appearance on the show, attributing the backlash to the platform's chaotic nature and the misinterpretation of her words.

title: Dick Van Dyke reveals daily habits and lifestyle secrets to live beyond 100
content: Iconic entertainer Dick Van Dyke, nearing 100, shares his secrets to a vibrant life. His regimen includes daily exercise, yoga, and a playful spirit.  Van Dyke emphasizes embracing new experiences, maintaining strong social bonds, and crucially, abstaining from alcohol and cigarettes.  His optimistic outlook fuels his remarkable longevity and active engagement with the world.

title: Shami’s India snub: Ganguly questions Agarkar - 'Don't see any reason'
content: Mohammed Shami's stellar domestic form, bagging 11 wickets in three matches, sparks debate over his national team exclusion. Former BCCI chief Sourav Ganguly questions the selectors' decision, citing Shami's immense skill. Despite injury setbacks post-World Cup, the veteran pacer's experience could bolster India's bowling attack, especially in ODIs, ensuring a smooth transition.

title: Gill, Sudarshan, and gaps around them: What puzzles must GT solve at auction
content: With only 5 wins in 14 matches and a win percentage of 41.7, the 2024 season was a disaster for the Gujarat Titans as they finished 8th in the point table. However, GT had a good season last year after the mega auction and qualified for the playoffs, but were defeated in the Eliminator by the Mumbai Indians (MI).

title: Goa club fire: Shack owned by Luthra brothers to be razed; interpol notice out
content: Goa orders demolition of Romeo Lane nightclub after a fire killed 25. Investigations suggest deaths were avoidable, with senior IPS officers allegedly intervening to block previous notices and FIRs against the club. Call records of implicated officers may link them to club owners.

title: Brittany Mahomes goes silent after Mahomes-Kelce meltdown hits Chiefs
content: Kansas City Chiefs faced a tough loss against the Houston Texans. Quarterback Patrick Mahomes and player Travis Kelce struggled on the field. Brittany Mahomes, wife of Patrick Mahomes, remained silent on social media after the game. This quiet response mirrored the disappointment felt by many fans. The team's playoff hopes are now uncertain.

title: How a teammate with broken hand helped Sachin earn his India cap
content: Sachin Tendulkar recalled a 1989-90 Irani Cup match where Gursharan Singh batted with a broken hand to help Tendulkar reach his century. Singh's selfless act, despite his injury, allowed Tendulkar to score 103 runs and subsequently earn his India selection. Tendulkar expressed deep gratitude for Singh's remarkable gesture and commitment to supporting a teammate.

title: 'Was eying my elder daughter': Live-in partner slits techie's throat; calls cops to confess
content: A 35-year-old engineer was murdered by his 46-year-old live-in partner and her two daughters in Lucknow. The woman confessed to slitting his throat after an argument over his alleged "inappropriate intentions" towards her elder daughter. The deceased had been tutoring the daughters since 2012.

title: Will JEE Main and CUET shift to pen-and-paper after new recommendations by the parliamentary panel?
content: A parliamentary standing committee has highlighted repeated disruptions in major NTA exams, including UGC-NET, CSIR-NET, NEET-PG, NEET-UG, CUET and JEE Main. The panel recommended a shift towards pen-and-paper testing, citing successful CBSE and UPSC models, and urged that CBTs be held only in government-controlled centres. It also called for a nationwide blacklist of tainted vendors and advised using NTA’s Rs 448-crore surplus to strengthen internal exam capabilities and regulatory systems.

title: 'Falling' for him: Mistress dangles from 10th-floor balcony in China after lover’s wife returns home — Watch
content: A woman, reportedly a mistress, narrowly escaped a perilous fall from a 10th-floor balcony in China after her lover's wife arrived unexpectedly. Witnesses watched in horror as she dangled precariously before sliding down drainpipes and windowsills to safety.  The incident, captured on video, has sparked widespread online discussion and embarrassment for those involved.

title: 'You were working for Britishers': Kharge flays BJP; Vande Mataram debate rages in RS
content: Rajya Sabha session on Vande Mataram's 150 years turned combative as Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge accused BJP's predecessors of working for the British. Home minister Amit Shah rejected claims of political timing, urging members to view the song's significance beyond elections.

title: 'Cheap sensationalism': Mahieka photographed inappropriately; Pandya hits out at paparazzi
content: Hardik Pandya strongly condemned paparazzi for intrusive photography of Mahieka Sharma, calling it disrespectful and cheap sensationalism. He urged the media to be more mindful and respect boundaries, emphasising that not everything needs to be captured. Meanwhile, Pandya is nearing a T20I milestone of 2,000 runs and 100 wickets.

title: Gabrielle Union says she and Dwyane Wade 'weren’t in a good place' when he fathered a child
content: Gabrielle Union has opened up about the devastation she felt when Dwyane Wade fathered a child with another woman during a brief breakup in 2013. Despite the trauma, the couple worked through the issue, with Wade admitting their marriage isn't perfect and requires ongoing effort. They reunited and married in 2014.

title: Indonesia fire: Massive blaze engulfs seven-story office building in Jakarta; 20 killed
content: A devastating fire ripped through a seven-storey office building in Jakarta, claiming at least 20 lives as smoke trapped workers inside. Flames erupted in the afternoon, spreading quickly and causing widespread panic. Firefighters battled the inferno, with dense smoke engulfing the area. Efforts to find survivors continued amidst the tragedy.

title: Security scare at Vijay's rally: Man held with gun at TVK event — key details
content: A man carrying a licensed handgun was detained at a Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam rally in Puducherry after tight security was implemented following a fatal stampede. The rally, restricted to 5,000 attendees with QR codes, saw large crowds gather outside, with party functionaries clashing with police over entry restrictions.

title: 'India in Reform Express phase': PM hails rapid changes; focus on 'ease of life'
content: Prime Minister Modi declared India is in a "Reform Express" phase, prioritising citizen well-being and ease of life alongside business. He urged MPs to address ground-level issues, aiming to simplify governance by reducing bureaucratic hurdles and paperwork. The PM also voiced concern over IndiGo's flight disruptions, emphasizing that system improvements shouldn't inconvenience the public.

title: 'Dhurandhar' box office collection day 5: Ranveer starrer inches towards Rs 140 crore
content: Aditya Dhar's directorial 'Dhurandhar', featuring Ranveer Singh and a stellar cast, has taken the box office by storm, crossing ₹100 crore in its opening weekend. The film witnessed impressive growth, with Sunday collections soaring to ₹43 crore. While Monday saw a natural dip, the movie continues to perform strongly, accumulating ₹129.

title: 5% cut: Government finally aligns IndiGo flights with airline's operating ability
content: IndiGo faces a 5% cut in its winter flight schedule from the DGCA. The airline failed to operate its approved flights efficiently. This reduction impacts high-demand routes. IndiGo must submit a revised schedule soon. Other airlines like Air India and Akasa also saw schedule reductions. SpiceJet, however, increased its operations.

title: Trump’s tariff threat on Indian rice! Why US, not India, has more to worry - explained
content: US President Trump has threatened further tariffs on Indian rice, accusing India of 'dumping' products. Despite existing high tariffs, Indian rice exports to the US remain strong, particularly premium basmati. Experts suggest this is election-season messaging, as increased duties would primarily impact American consumers and not significantly harm Indian exporters.

title: 'Burning' empire: Goa nightclub blaze that toppled Luthra brothers; how nightlife kingdom collapsed
content: A decade-old restaurant venture, Romeo Lane, expanded rapidly across India and Dubai, attracting mall developers and franchisees. However, a devastating fire at a Goa outlet, which killed 25, exposed alleged safety violations and a lack of oversight, sparking public outrage and questions of accountability for the Luthra brothers.

title: Odisha village tense after woman found beheaded: Mob torches 150 homes; internet cut
content: In the wake of a disturbing crime, tensions erupted in the Malkangiri district of Odisha as an Adivasi community took drastic action against a village of settlers from Bangladesh, prompted by the discovery of a woman's beheaded body. Fueled by suspicions of a land dispute, the enraged mob set around 150 homes ablaze.

title: 'Why Sunny Leone?': Ashwin's cryptic post leaves fans guessing; until real 'Sunny' emerges
content: Ravichandran Ashwin's cryptic social media post, a visual pun combining Sunny Leone and Sadhu Street, baffled fans until they realised it was a tribute to young cricketer Sunny Sandhu. Sandhu's match-winning cameo in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy earned him this unique endorsement, potentially boosting his profile ahead of the IPL 2026 auction.

title: 'IndiGo being held accountable': Aviation minister in Parliament; assures 'ops stabilising'
content: Civil Aviation Minister Ram Mohan Naidu stated in Lok Sabha that IndiGo is being held accountable for its operational crisis, with services rapidly stabilizing. He assured that passenger convenience and dignity are being protected, and long-term measures are in place to enhance India's aviation sector, emphasizing no airline will be permitted to inconvenience passengers.

title: Right to Disconnect Bill 2025: What it means for employees in India - explained
content: India’s Right to Disconnect Bill 2025 empowers employees to ignore work communications outside official hours without facing penalties. Introduced by NCP MP Supriya Sule, the bill proposes an Employees’ Welfare Authority to monitor compliance, investigate complaints, and impose fines on non-compliant firms. Similar laws exist in France, Italy, Portugal, and Australia, ensuring work-life balance, while the U.S. lacks comprehensive protections. The legislation addresses burnout, digital overload, and the need for clear boundaries between professional and personal life.

title: 'Bacchey bade ho jate hain': Wasim Akram takes dig at IPL duration, calls PSL No.1
content: Former Pakistan cricketer Wasim Akram sparked debate by suggesting the IPL's extended duration becomes monotonous, contrasting it with the Pakistan Super League's shorter, more appealing format for international players. He cited the Big Bash League's shift to a shorter window as evidence, emphasizing the PSL's bowling depth and competitive edge.

title: 'Rules are good but ... ': PM weighs in on IndiGo chaos; stresses people must not face trouble
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi stressed that rules must aid, not harass the public, amidst IndiGo's ongoing flight crisis. The airline's operational issues stem from new pilot rest rules, impacting thousands of passengers. Union minister Kiren Rijiju conveyed the PM's concern, emphasising passenger convenience and urging MPs to focus on public-centric reforms.

title: ‘8888 is lucky’: Haryana IT executive bids Rs 1.17cr for VIP number; backs out later
content: IT executive Sudhir, who bid over Rs 1.1 crore for VIP number HR88B-8888, now claims the number is not worth the price and he will not bid again. He cited astrological advice for his interest in the number, but intense bidding pushed him to the final amount. Sudhir welcomes any probe into the matter.

title: Goa nightclub fire: Bengaluru data analyst dies while trying to retrieve his phone
content: A 25-year-old Bengaluru man, Mohammed Ishaq, tragically died in a Goa nightclub fire early Sunday morning. He was on a bachelor party trip with friends and reportedly went back inside the club to retrieve his phone. His body showed minor burns, and police stated he died in a stampede while exiting.

title: DGCA cuts IndiGo flight schedules by 5%; 115 daily flights reduced — what it means
content: The aviation regulator DGCA has reduced IndiGo's flights by five percent. This decision follows a period of significant flight cancellations. IndiGo's operations were impacted by new pilot duty rules and an increase in flights. Other airlines saw minor adjustments to their schedules. Aviation authorities are reviewing the situation.

title: Andhra Pradesh reviews policy reforms on TDR and coastal-city flood planning
content: Official calls for swift stakeholder consultations as State works on land-value framework and climate-resilient drainage plan

title: Census will include question on reasons for migration: Government
content: The Census 2027 will be conducted in two phases – the first is the House Listing and Housing Census, between April and September 2026; and the second, Population Enumeration (PE), in February 2027

title: Seven held for smuggling ganja from Agency areas
content: Police seize 14 bikes and 5 kg of ganja from the accused after nabbing them at Auto Nagar in Vijayawada recently

title: Siddaramaiah writes to PM, reminding about plight of toor farmers
content: The Chief Minister pointed out that while the peak arrivals are expected between December-January, the Union government will open procurement centres only in February-March.

title: Malappuram gears up to elect representatives for 2,789 wards
content: Elections are being held for 2,789 seats across 122 local bodies, including 12 municipalities, 15 block panchayats and 94 grama panchayats, the highest number in any district in the State

title: 604 local bodies in seven northern Kerala districts to see elections on Thursday in Phase II
content: Arrangements in place for the conduct of elections in Thrissur, Palakkad, Malappuram, Wayanad, Kozhikode, Kannur and Kasaragod districts

title: Shun politics of the past, reach out to all communities, Anbumani tells PMK functionaries
content: At a meeting of the party’s union, town panchayat, corporation area secretaries and presidents at Mamallapuram, he says he is not an enemy of any community

title: Naidu urges NDA cadre to join Atal Sandesh tour honouring Vajpayee’s legacy
content: Chief Minister calls for active participation in December 11–25 outreach; BJP State president says the tour will begin at Dharmavaram with daily programmes across two districts

title: Goa nightclub fire: PIL plea in Bombay High Court seeks SIT probe, State-wide safety audit
content: Petition blames “systemic failure” for Arpora blaze that killed 25, demands closure of illegal clubs across Goa

title: Agriculture Minister orders urgent steps to curb pest attack on chilli crop
content: Atchannaidu tells officials to rush scientists to affected areas and set up special teams to guide farmers on pesticide use and preventive measures

title: High-octane finish to Thrissur’s local body poll campaign
content: A total of 7,284 candidates are in the fray for 2,204 seats in the district.  The LDF aims to retain its dominance, while the UDF seeks to reclaim crucial seats, Meanwhile, the NDA hopes to make a significant impact.

title: Minister-led delegation meets CM for new ‘Gokak district’
content: The delegation was led by PWD Minister and district-in-charge Satish Jarkiholi and comprised leaders from BJP, Congress and JD(S), and religious leaders

title: Karnataka government to start 700 KPS Magnet Schools in next two years
content: Education organisations urge the government to issue an official order that no government schools will be closed

title: A.P. CM Naidu to lead a team to WEF meet in Davos in January 2026
content: The A.P. delegation includes HRD and IT Minister Nara Lokesh, Industries Minister T.G. Bharath and senior IAS officers

title: A.P. Chambers to host business expo in Vijayawada from December 12
content: The three-day event will showcase business opportunities, emerging technologies, entrepreneurship, and cultural performances, apart from 160 stalls across sectors

title: BJP should have ideally protested against Centre, says Shivakumar
content: Deputy Chief Minister D.K. Shivakumar says it is the Centre which has meted out injustice to the farmers of the State

title: Shastra VC launches deep-tech fellowship
content: Shastra VC has invested in more than 30 Startups including Alt Carbon, Simplismart, SISIR Radar, Sanlayan, and Inspecity, among others

title: GoM formed to finalise Andhra Pradesh State Litigation Policy, 2025
content: The initiative aims to strengthen dispute resolution mechanisms and enhance accountability and transparency in legal administration

title: Andhra Pradesh sanctions ₹13.4 crore for LiDAR survey to speed up Godavari Delta modernisation
content: Minister Nimmala Ramanaidu says survey to be completed quickly as State pushes flood mitigation, irrigation upgrades and revival of delta productivity

title: Look Out Circular issued against two more owners of Goa nightclub: Police
content: North Goa DIG said the Goa Police is seeking the help of Interpol to bring back Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra, who fled to Phuket

title: AI emerges as game-changer for Indian farmers: Union Minister
content: From early pest detection to monsoon forecasting, the government is scaling AI tools across 13 States, reaching more than 3.88 million farmers, he says

title: Andhra Pradesh leads country with highest number of industrial parks, says Union Minister
content: State has 638 of India’s 4,597 industrial parks as Centre outlines national distribution; Eluru MP urges stronger support for A.P.’s industrial growth and food processing sector

title: Adoor Prakash’s remark rewrites poll-day narrative in central Travancore
content: His remark about actor Dileep getting justice in actor rape case draw flak from LDF, with leaders terming it a reflection of anti-women stance harboured by Congress

title: Polavaram Gap-2 works gather pace as stone-laying begins
content: Officials say upstream stone-filling, soil-laying near the diaphragm wall and Gap-1 activities are progressing as per schedule

title: TVK reschedules Vijay’s Erode public meeting to December 18 over ‘police conditions’
content: K.A. Sengottaiyan, chief coordinator of the party’s high-level administrative committee, claimed the police had raised queries regarding preparedness in case of rain or extreme heat, the list of attendees, and their identity cards

title: Karti Chidambaram moves Madras High Court against attachment of ₹90.08 lakh by ED
content: The ED had attached the money from two of his bank accounts after commencing a money laundering probe on the basis of the CBI’s Aircel-Maxis case

title: SIR exercise arbitrary, only aims to delete voters: Trinamool MP Kalyan Banerjee
content: “Why should an elector, whose name was there in 2024 (voter list), be told that he is not an elector because his name was not there in 2002,” says Kalyan Banerjee

title: 'Vande Mataram' debate: TMC MPs hold silent protest against 'insult' of Bengal icons by BJP
content: The protest came a day after a discussion on 150 years of "Vande Mataram" was held in the Lok Sabha. The debate was initiated by Prime Minister Narendra Modi

title: Facing repeated defeats, Opposition finds flaws with EVMs, SIR: BJP MP in Lok Sabha
content: BJP MP Sanjay Jaiswal said that despite Opposition's claims that his party will benefit most from simultaneous polls, the reality is that it will possibly be the other way round

title: Delhi High Court ruled in favour of Ramadoss, Anbumani has nothing to do with PMK: G.K. Mani
content: Speaking to reporters at Thailapuram near Tindivanam, Mr. Mani said that the founder would continue to lead the party and decide on alliances for the upcoming Assembly elections

title: Goa government orders demolition of Vagator beach shack of Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra
content: Interpol has issued a Blue Corner notice against Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra, according to the Goa Chief Minister's Office

title: Decision to use first two stanzas of ‘Vande Mataram’ was not of Nehru alone: Congress president Kharge
content: The Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge also quoted Tagore, who said he found "no difficulty" in dissociating the first two stanzas of the poem with the rest of the song

title: Bengal polls will be announced soon after publication of voters' list to block legal challenge: CM
content: Stepping up her attack on the Centre, CM Mamata Banerjee accused the BJP-led government of running an “anarchic and autocratic” regime

title: Delhi court notice to Sonia Gandhi, police on plea claiming ‘forgery’ in electoral roll inclusion
content: Issuing notice to Sonia Gandhi and Delhi Police, Judge Gogne posted the matter on January 6 for further proceedings

title: LDF convener in Kerala revives debate on SilverLine, BJP sees red
content: T.P. Ramakrishnan claims the Railway Ministry has come up with a new proposal for enhancing rail connectivity in the State.

title: Kerala CM defends support for survivor in actor assault case, says Dileep’s conspiracy allegation ‘only a perception’
content: Pinarayi says prosecution handled the case effectively and the verdict will undergo legal scrutiny before further action

title: ‘Investment in education and healthcare is usually underrated, but is actually one of the most significant contributors to upholding human rights’
content: Universal School of Law organises dialogue to address the question: Why India ranks high on GDP, but low on human rights

title: Electoral reforms possible only when ECI is impartial, says Akhilesh Yadav
content: Participating in a debate on 'Election Reforms', he made a slew of allegations to claim that the poll authority was not functioning with neutrality

title: No scarcity of key anti-TB drugs in central, State stocks: Union Minister
content: The Union Minister Of State for Health said that National Tuberculosis Elimination Programme is being implemented under the aegis of National Health Mission across the country

title: T.N. BJP condemns Opposition’s bid to move impeachment motion against Justice Swaminathan
content: The judge had ordered the lighting of a lamp at the deepathoon (pillar) located near a dargah atop the Thirupparankundram hill in Madurai

title: Capping MBBS seats by NMC deferred for academic years 2024-25, 2025-26: Nadda
content: The decision to postpone the seat capping aims to address regional disparities in medical education access, particularly in southern States, amid concerns from lawmakers and stakeholders

title: Kerala actor rape case: Hope court will give maximum punishment to the guilty, says actor-filmmaker Lal
content: Lal says it was him and not late Congress MLA P.T. Thomas who first informed then State Police Chief Loknath Behera about the survivor’s ordeal

title: DPIIT committee on AI and copyright suggests compromise position on data mining
content: Data crawlers for training AI models should not be restricted, a government working paper said. However, it added, all rightsholders would have to be paid for their contributions

title: CBI books Anil Ambani’s son, Reliance Home Finance Ltd. in ₹228 crore bank fraud case
content: The CBI acted on a complaint from the bank (erstwhile Andhra Bank) against Reliance Home Finance Ltd., Jai Anmol Anil Ambani and Ravindra Sharad Sudhakar, both directors in RHFL

title: A pause in Odisha: The sanctuary that feels like a secret
content: Two hours from Jharsuguda lies Debrigarh sanctuary run by tribal communities — we visit to discover boat safaris to Bat Island, stargazer suites, wildlife drives with chousingha, and crisp fried fish at sunset.

title: SIR hearing: Inclusion of CAA-protected refugees in electoral roll dependent on whether they meet conditions of naturalisation, says Supreme Court
content: The Court said that even though the Citizenship (Amendment) Act, 2019 have introduced changes in favour of granting persecuted religious minorities from these countries, every such claim would have to be enquired into and determined by the authorities

title: Chargers pull ahead in OT to defeat Eagles in tight MNF win
content: It was the biggest win of the season for a Chargers team that appeared to be spiraling out of playoff contention.

title: Hurts has 2 turnovers on 1 play amid 4-INT night
content: Eagles quarterback Jalen Hurts became the first player since 1978 -- as far back as research goes -- to commit two turnovers on the same play during Monday night's overtime loss to the Chargers.

title: Tigers prez: No 'untouchables,' including Skubal
content: Tigers ace Tarik Skubal, even after back-to-back Cy Young Awards, is not "untouchable" when it comes to trade offers, president of baseball operations Scott Harris said.

title: Daly: NHL players won't play if Olympic ice unsafe
content: Bill Daly told owners that he didn't believe construction issues with the ice hockey rink were "insurmountable," but that the league's bigger concern as it gets ready to send players to the Olympics for the first time in over a decade is the ice quality.

title: Sources: Ailing Colts to work out retired QB Rivers
content: The Indianapolis Colts will work out retired quarterback Philip Rivers on Tuesday, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Sources: 4 LSU coaches rejoin Rebels for CFP run
content: Sources told ESPN's Pete Thamel on Monday that four current LSU offensive assistants are joining offensive coordinator Charlie Weis Jr. at Ole Miss to help prepare the Rebels for their College Football Playoff appearance, which begins Dec. 20 vs. Tulane.

title: Notre Dame AD: ACC caused 'permanent damage'
content: Notre Dame's AD ripped the ACC after its CFP snub, saying the conference that houses almost every Fighting Irish team has caused "permanent damage" to the relationship.

title: Mendoza, Pavia, Love, Sayin in Heisman's final 4
content: After leading Indiana to its first Big Ten title in 58 years, Fernando Mendoza was announced as a Heisman Trophy finalist Monday, joining Vanderbilt quarterback Diego Pavia, Notre Dame running back Jeremiyah Love and Ohio State quarterback Julian Sayin.

title: Ohtani ties mark with 4th AP Male Athlete of Year
content: Dodgers superstar Shohei Ohtani capped another championship year by winning The Associated Press Male Athlete of the Year for a record-tying fourth time.

title: Solak's Week 14 lessons: How to fix the Chiefs' offense and why the Jaguars should be taken seriously
content: Ben Solak lays out ways to improve the Chiefs' struggling offense, makes his case for the Jaguars' legitimacy and looks at wild Week 14 stats and trends.

title: Updated NFL Power Rankings: New 1-32 poll, plus most shocking statistics of this season
content: We unveil our latest rankings and also look at the most surprising statistical rankings for each team.

title: Shams' NBA trade buzz: Why all eyes are on AD, Giannis and Kuminga
content: As NBA trade season nears, the futures of Anthony Davis and Giannis Antetokounmpo are in focus. Here's everything we're hearing.

title: Peralta to Red Sox? Greene to Dodgers? Best fits for top potential pitching trade candidates
content: A number of teams have the need -- and means -- to trade for a starting pitcher this winter. Here's how they match up with available hurlers.

title: Wetzel: Relax, the CFP selection process is (mostly) working
content: Don't overreact to this year's playoff rankings by blowing up the system. Chasing perfection is a fool's errand.

title: CFP Anger Index: An absurd farce over Notre Dame, Miami
content: Evaluating the committee's ranking process, and what teams should be most upset about in final CFP ranking.

title: Jimmy V Men's Classic guide: What to watch in UConn-Florida, BYU-Clemson
content: Can the Huskies hold off the Gators in a battle of recent national champions? Here are the keys to both games.

title: Men's Bracketology: Iowa State replaces Purdue as a 1-seed
content: In knocking off former 1-seed Purdue, unbeaten Iowa State changed its trajectory and is now on the top line.

title: How the 2026 World Cup already killed the 'group of death'
content: Everyone wants to know: which teams are in the group of death for the 2026 World Cup? Well, the "group of death" may be officially dead.

title: Which NHL player and team trends are for real? The trend-o-meter for all 32
content: From Morgan Geekie's scoring rate to the 'Wall of St. Paul' and more, here's what will and won't continue.

title: The NHL's best this week: Terry Ryan and hockey dreams
content: From first-round draft pick to iconic character, Ryan's path is a unique one. Plus, this week's key NHL games.

title: Do college sports need a CBA? Some ADs are starting to think so﻿
content: A growing number of athletic directors say they are interested in exploring a once-unthinkable option.

title: Betting on the 2025 CFP? All the predictions, odds and best bets bettors need
content: Breaking down the field, the best bets, plus what the sportsbooks are seeing ahead of the first round.

title: How each of the 12 College Football Playoff teams could win the national title
content: Bill Connelly breaks down the path to victory for every team -- and what will hold each of them back.

title: Men: New No. 1 after Purdue's shock loss
content: The fifth in-season men's AP Top 25 poll for 2025-26 is out. Here's what's next for every team in the ranking.

title: Free agents: Trevor Lawrence and Packers WRs among top options
content: All the free agent options worth adding as we look dive into Week 15 and the fantasy football playoffs.

title: Buzz: Etienne, Pollard and Godwin among players who were getting the ball on Sunday
content: Eric Moody's notebook highlights participation and usage trends that drove fantasy highs and lows on Sunday

title: Salah vs. Slot at Liverpool? Arsenal not ready to be title favorites? Premier League overreactions
content: Arne Slot and Mo Salah can no longer coexist? Arsenal are feeling the pressure? Let's overreact to last weekend's Premier League action.

title: Boxing divisional rankings: Foster cruises past Fulton, moves up at junior lightweight
content: O'Shaquie Foster was dominant against Stephen Fulton, earning higher ranking. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

title: In winning F1 title, Norris proves himself (and his doubters) wrong
content: Lando Norris doubted himself as a title contender earlier this year. Now, as the curtain falls on the F1 season, he can call himself a world champion.

title: Week 14 only added more chaos to the NFL playoff race -- "a bookmaker's dream"
content: Week 14 "set the tone" for many NFL teams as Super Bowl favorites faltered and underdogs picked up steam.

title: Early Week 15 bets: Patriots over Bills, Lions to cover in shootout with Rams
content: What lines offered value once odds came out? Here are five games we're eyeing for bets going into Week 15.

title: QBs Cam Ward, Shedeur Sanders swap jerseys after Titans' victory
content: The Browns and Titans rookies exchanged comical trash talk while swapping jerseys following Tennessee's 31-29 win at Cleveland.

title: Pickups: Ryan Nembhard, Quentin Grimes among players to add
content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: UFC 323 fight grades: Why Dvalishvili-Yan wasn't the best fight on the card
content: Which fights were the best and worst of the last UFC PPV of 2025? Andreas Hale grades every fight from UFC 323.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Neymar eyes Europe, MLS move for World Cup
content: Santos forward Neymar is set to consider a move back to Europe or MLS if he doesn't stay in Brazil. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Congress Chief Slams BJP For 'Insulting' Nehru Over Vande Mataram Stanzas
content: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge on Tuesday accused BJP leaders, including PM Modi, of insulting Jawaharlal Nehru. He said the decision to use only the first 2 stanzas of 'Vande Mataram' as the national song was collectively taken.

title: 'Standing Near Train Door In Peak Hours Not Negligence': Bombay High Court
content: A person travelling for work in suburban trains during peak hours has no choice but to risk his life by standing near the train door, and this cannot be termed as negligence, the Bombay High Court said.

title: Adani Group Pledges Over $75 Billion Investment In Energy Transition In Next 5 Years
content: Gautam Adani, Chairman of the Adani Group, announced on Tuesday that the Group will invest over USD 75 billion in the energy transition over the next five years.

title: Centre Orders IndiGo To Cut Flights By 10% After Days Of Chaos
content: IndiGo, the country's largest airline, will have to cut down its operations by 10 per cent, the government has decided in view of the massive crisis sparked by its 2000-plus flight cancellations in recent days.

title: After Goa Fire, Gurugram Police Ramps Up Safety Checks On Nightclubs, Bars
content: Following the recent tragic fire incident at a Goa nightclub, Gurugram Police have ramped up safety enforcement across all nightlife establishments in the city.

title: Netanyahu, Trump To Meet On Dec 29, Discuss "Opportunities For Peace": Report
content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu will meet President Donald Trump in the United States on December 29, a spokeswoman for the premier's office told AFP on Tuesday.

title: "Bow Your Head": Mamata Banerjee Seeks PM Modi's Apology Over 'Bankim Da'
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday demanded an apology from Prime Minister Narendra Modi for allegedly insulting legendary novelist Bankim Chandra Chattopadhyay by referring to him as "Bankim da" in Parliament.

title: Indian-Origin Arkin Gupta Named In Forbes Under-30 For Financial Innovation
content: Indian-origin Arkin Gupta has made it to the Forbes list of achievers under the age of 30 for his significant contributions to financial innovation and early-stage investment strategies.

title: India Records Highest-Ever Exports In First Half Of FY26
content: Overall exports in the first half of FY 2025-26, covering April to September 2025, reached $ 418.6 billion, rising from $ 395.7 billion in the same period last year, Minister of State for Commerce and Industry Ministry Jitin Prasada said.

title: 'For Family's Safety': Zohran Mamdani To Move To $100 Million Gracie Mansion
content: New York mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani announced that his wife and he are ready to move to the mayor's residence in Manhattan after he takes office in January. He said the decision was made keeping in mind the family's safety.

title: Delhi Man Arrested For Hoax Bomb Threats To Top Cops To Frame Rival
content: The Delhi Police on Tuesday arrested a man in a case of cyber harassment and criminal intimidation for sending a series of threat emails to top police officials across multiple states.

title: NDTV Exclusive: Goa Nightclub Owner Gaurav Luthra Spotted In Thailand
content: Gaurav and his brother, Saurabh, flew out to Thailand's Phuket on an IndiGo flight at 5:30 am on Sunday - just a couple of hours after the tragedy.

title: Maharashtra's 'Organised Crime' Solution To Sale Of 'Gutkha' Around Schools
content: Cracking down on the sale of 'gutkha' and other prohibited substances near educational institutions, Maharashtra Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis has said the stringent Maharashtra Control of Organised Crime Act will be amended,

title: Demolition At Second Club Owned By Luthras, Missing Since Goa Fire
content: "Romeo Lane" -- a beach shack in Goa's Vagator owned by restaurant chain owner Luthra brothers -- is being demolished following an order by Chief Minister Pramod Sawant.

title: BJP Ex-MP Kirit Somaiya Claims "Fake Birth Certificate Racket" Across States
content: Former BJP MP Kirit Somaiya has intensified his allegations of a widespread fake birth certificate network, claiming that the operation extends across multiple states and could influence electoral rolls.

title: Kazakhstan Dancer Performed Without Business Visa During Goa Nightclub Fire
content: Kazakh national Kristina, who was dancing at the 'Birch by Romeo Lane' nightclub when a massive blaze erupted and claimed 25 lives, didn't have the business visa to perform in India, police said on Tuesday.

title: Kolkata Man's Decomposed Body Found, Family Stayed With Corpse For Days
content: The incident took place in Kabsa's Bosepukur area in south Kolkata. With the efforts of the locals, the police recovered the body from their residence on Monday.

title: Unemployed Man With MBA Degree Arrested In Delhi For Phone Snatching
content: An MBA graduate from a reputed university, who allegedly turned to snatching, was arrested in southwest Delhi's Dwarka with seven stolen mobile phones and a lifted scooter, police said on Tuesday.

title: "Shameful": Tamil Nadu BJP Slams INDIA Bloc Over Impeachment Notice Against Judge In Temple Lamp Row
content: The Tamil Nadu BJP on Tuesday criticised the Opposition MPs for submitting a letter to Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla to move a motion in Parliament for the removal of Justice GR Swaminathan of the Madurai Bench of the Madras High Court.

title: India-Pak, Israel-Iran, Congo War: 5 Major Conflicts Around The World In 2025
content: The year 2025 witnessed a series of major armed conflicts that reshaped regional security dynamics and tested diplomatic frameworks across the globe.
